FuncDef: The TCP/IP traceroute utility determines the route to a destination address. DNS lookups of the responding hosts are enabled by default.
CLIs: traceroute { <ip-address> | <dns-name> } [ ttl <ttl> ] [ wait <milli-seconds> ] [ no-dns ] [ source <ip-address> ] [ tos <type-of-service> ] [ { router <router-or-service> | router instance <router-instance> | service-name <router-instanceservice-name> } ] [ detail ]

ParaDef.Info: The far-end IP address to which to send the traceroute request message in dotted decimal notation.
The DNS name of the far-end device to which to send the traceroute request message, expressed as a character string.
The maximum Time-To-Live (TTL) value to include in the traceroute request, expressed as a decimal integer. Values-1 to 255.
The time in milliseconds to wait for a response to a probe, expressed as a decimal integer. Values-1 to 60000. ParamDefault: Default- 5000
When the no-dns keyword is specified, DNS lookups of the responding hosts will not be performed, and only the IP addresses will be printed.
The source IP address to use as the source of the probe packets in dotted decimal notation. If the IP address is not one of the device s interfaces, an error is returned.
The type-of-service (TOS) bits in the IP header of the probe packets, expressed as a decimal integer. Values-0 to 255.

Specifies the routing instance or service, by number. The router-instance parameter is preferred parameter for specifying the router or service. Values-{router-name | vprn-svc-id}. ParamDefault: Default- Base
Specifies the alias function that allows the service-name to be used, converted and stored as service ID.

Specifies the preferred method for entering a service name. Stored as the service name. Only service linking function that is allowed for both mixed-mode and model-driven configuration modes. Values-{router-name | vprn-svc-name}.
Displays MPLS label stack information, if available.
